snippet: New Yorkers vote overwhelmingly for Democratic politicians, but immigrants from the former Soviet Union are an exception, perhaps because of Communism’s legacy.
abstract: New Yorkers are expected to overwhelmingly support the reelection of Pres Obama, but presumptive Republican opponent Mitt Romney can expect considerable support from enclaves of the city's Russian and Ukranian immigrants; these voters tend to see Republicans as ardent warriors against the kind of big-government programs that soured their lives in the Soviet Union.
lead_paragraph: New Yorkers vote overwhelmingly for Democratic politicians, but immigrants from the former Soviet Union are an exception, perhaps because of Communism’s legacy.

headline.seo: Among Russian Immigrants in New York, Affinity for Republicans
headline.main: Among New York’s Soviet Immigrants, Affinity for G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Among City’s Soviet Immigrants, An Affinity for Republicans
